page.title: 07Home Life, Fashion, The Past
page.content: The fashion for girls was lace-up boots & shoes with straight straps across. People did not wear training shoes but wore plimsoles & sandals. They wore no trousers or tight skirts for ladies, while gentlemen wore thick long-sleeved shirts & knee-length shorts or "Oxford bags". Most girls had their hair long in plaits or tied back. Boys had the style called "Eton Crop "from the way the students at the college had their hair cut . Females wore rayon or lyle stockings & the rich had silk stockings. Tights were only worn by theatrical people .A few girls wore hats.
